# ubuntu-ssh
ubuntu-ssh



# ssh-keygen -t rsa

    
    sangbinlee9@master:~/.ssh$ ssh-keygen -t rsa
    Generating public/private rsa key pair.
    Enter file in which to save the key (/home/sangbinlee9/.ssh/id_rsa):
    Enter passphrase (empty for no passphrase):
    Enter same passphrase again:
    Your identification has been saved in /home/sangbinlee9/.ssh/id_rsa
    Your public key has been saved in /home/sangbinlee9/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
    The key fingerprint is:
    SHA256:M8D6yehLFus3s14f8YGNjXJjrF72a67/+gnhP74aGRs sangbinlee9@master
    The key's randomart image is:
    +---[RSA 3072]----+
    |                 |
    |     .           |
    |      o          |
    |     . . . *     |
    |    o   S X E    |
    |     * . B = B   |
    |    = + o + B    |
    |   =  +o + o.+.. |
    |    ++o+. o=BBBo |
    +----[SHA256]-----+
    sangbinlee9@master:~/.ssh$ ll
    total 16
    drwx------  2 sangbinlee9 sangbinlee9 4096 Oct 22 00:55 ./
    drwxr-x--- 10 sangbinlee9 sangbinlee9 4096 Oct 22 00:52 ../
    -rw-------  1 sangbinlee9 sangbinlee9 2602 Oct 22 00:55 id_rsa
    -rw-r--r--  1 sangbinlee9 sangbinlee9  572 Oct 22 00:55 id_rsa.pub
    
    
    
    






# vi authorized_keys
    sangbinlee9@master:~/.ssh$ vi authorized_keys
    sangbinlee9@master:~/.ssh$ cat id_rsa.pub
    ssh-rsa  sangbinlee9@master
    sangbinlee9@master:~/.ssh$ vi authorized_keys
